III.i.1.A.3.a
.
Eligibility of Reservists for Compensation and Pension
Traditional service in the Reserves consists of a period of ADT for initial military training and job skill training.  A
DD Form 214
will be issued documenting this period of initial ADT.  Thereafter, a reservist will perform IADT, traditionally occurring one weekend monthly, as well as 15 days of ADT annually.
A reservist may meet the criteria for establishing Veteran status for compensation and pension purposes if any of the criteria for active service are met.
References
:  For more information on
what constitutes active service, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 1.A.1.b
considering claims based on ADT and IADT, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 1.A.2
, and
compensation and pension eligibility for National Guard service, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 1.A.4
.
